MSJC Resolution 2007/08-054 - Approval to execute agreement for legal services incidental to formation of a SFID

Thursday, March 18th, 2010

FYI

Resolution 2007/08-054 - Approval of Agreement with Orrick Herrington & Sutcliff, LLP states “As part of the on-going research into the feasibility of forming a SFID in the Pass area, legal counsel is needed to assist the District in dialogue with the Riverside County Treasurer for further research as to the feasibility of forming the SFID.”

“Fees are contingent upon a successful issuance of bonds.”

MSJC Minutes 11/08/07 - m/sc Schlange/McGargill Moved to approve Item 2007/08-054 - Motion passed 3/1 Trustee Motte opposedÂ  (Trustee Sparkman - absent)

“Motte voiced concern that the college would hire a firm for bond counsel before the District has even proposed a bond.”

Riverside County Agenda Item 3.67/Resolution 2010-095 Pulled

Thursday, March 18th, 2010

FYI/Blog

According to the Riverside County Clerk’s office, Item 3.67/Resolution 2010-095 was deleted from the Riverside County Board of Supervisors Agenda March 16, 2010 at the request of the department.

In response to a public record request for disclosure of documents pertaining to the placement of this item on the agenda, Riverside County Clerk indicated said request needs to be made through the Tax Assessors Office.

A public record request has been made to the Tax Assessors Office.Â  District administration states that said resolution seeking county approval to form one or more SFID’s was NOT authorized by the District.

2007 Board Action: MSJC BOT Minutes 09/13/07/Item 2007/08-028 “Authorization to Form a SFID” m/sc Schlange/SparkmanÂ Â  - Â  Motion Passed 3/2 with Trustees McGargill and Motte opposed.

The 2007 Board Action provided authority to “research criteria needed to form a SFID, in particular Area 1″ with a provision that “all information required for this process will be brought back to the Board for further information and direction.”

Monday, March 15th, 2010

http://www.clerkoftheboard.co.riverside.ca.us/agendas/2010/03_16_2010.htm

FYIÂ Â  3.67Â Â Â Â  TREASURER-TAX COLLECTOR: Adoption of Resolution 2010-095 Authorizing Mt. San Jacinto Community College to Form One or More School Facilities Improvement Districts Under the Education Code, 1st, 3rd & 5th Districts.

“WHEREAS, MSJC has requested that this Board make the Law operative for the District in order that one or more school facilities improvement districts may be formed within a portion of the District and the voters within each such area may be asked to authorized the issuance of general obligation bonds to pay for certain school facilities improvements serving such area;” Etc.

Blog:

NO information has been provided to me on said resolution and recent District BOT agenda’s have no such disclosure.Â  In the interest of the taxpayers, it would seem most appropriate that MSJC administration would inform district trustees and the public prior to a request for approval by Riverside County.

Who determined the 1st, 3rd, & 5th Districts?Â  Not the MSJC BOT.
